column4: Hi!, don't know if here is appropriate but why wouldn't the following work:  echo "/home/anthony/" | xargs cd
well, for one its a really pointless way to do this .. cd "/home/anthony"
: okay i was playing around.  I wanted to go to a directory where a particular file was.. sort of find . -name myfile | xargs cd
well, that won't work because xargs requires a real command not a bash builtin like cd .. you could rewrite that as .   cd $(find /path ... )
